<div class="section" title="E.1. Motivation" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h2 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -62.40625px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3; clear:both">
<a target="_blank" name="t696" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e10848" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.1. Motivation</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Note: this feature was introduced in HBase 0.92</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
We found it necessary to revise the HFile format after encountering high memory usage and slow startup times caused by large Bloom filters and block indexes in the region server. Bloom filters can get as large as 100 MB per HFile, which adds up to 2 GB when
 aggregated over 20 regions. Block indexes can grow as large as 6 GB in aggregate size over the same set of regions. A region is not considered opened until all of its block index data is loaded. Large Bloom filters produce a different performance problem:
 the first get request that requires a Bloom filter lookup will incur the latency of loading the entire Bloom filter bit array.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
To speed up region server startup we break Bloom filters and block indexes into multiple blocks and write those blocks out as they fill up, which also reduces the HFile writer’s memory footprint. In the Bloom filter case, “filling up a block” means accumulating
 enough keys to efficiently utilize a fixed-size bit array, and in the block index case we accumulate an “index block” of the desired size. Bloom filter blocks and index blocks (we call these “inline blocks”) become interspersed with data blocks, and as a side
 effect we can no longer rely on the difference between block offsets to determine data block length, as it was done in version 1.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
HFile is a low-level file format by design, and it should not deal with application-specific details such as Bloom filters, which are handled at StoreFile level. Therefore, we call Bloom filter blocks in an HFile "inline" blocks. We also supply HFile with an
 interface to write those inline blocks.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Another format modification aimed at reducing the region server startup time is to use a contiguous “load-on-open” section that has to be loaded in memory at the time an HFile is being opened. Currently, as an HFile opens, there are separate seek operations
 to read the trailer, data/meta indexes, and file info. To read the Bloom filter, there are two more seek operations for its “data” and “meta” portions. In version 2, we seek once to read the trailer and seek again to read everything else we need to open the
 file from a contiguous block.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.2. HFile format version 1 overview" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h2 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -62.40625px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3; clear:both">
<a target="_blank" name="t697" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="apes02" id="apes02" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.2. HFile format version 1 overview</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
As we will be discussing the changes we are making to the HFile format, it is useful to give a short overview of the previous (HFile version 1) format. An HFile in the existing format is structured as follows: <span class="inlinemediaobject"><img src="http://abloz.com/hbase/images/hfile.png" alt="HFile Version 1" align="middle" style="border:none; max-width:100%"></span> <sup>[<a target="_blank" name="d1934e10876" href="http://abloz.com/hbase/book.html#ftn.d1934e10876" rel="nofollow" class="footnote" style="color:rgb(255,153,0); text-decoration:none">30</a>]</sup></p>
<div class="section" title="E.2.1.  Block index format in version 1" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t698" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e10883" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.2.1.  Block index format in version 1</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The block index in version 1 is very straightforward. For each entry, it contains:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Offset (long)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Uncompressed size (int)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key (a serialized byte array written using Bytes.writeByteArray)</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key length as a variable-length integer (VInt)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key bytes</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The number of entries in the block index is stored in the fixed file trailer, and has to be passed in to the method that reads the block index. One of the limitations of the block index in version 1 is that it does not provide the compressed size of a block,
 which turns out to be necessary for decompression. Therefore, the HFile reader has to infer this compressed size from the offset difference between blocks. We fix this limitation in version 2, where we store on-disk block size instead of uncompressed size,
 and get uncompressed size from the block header.</p>
</div>
<div class="footnotes" style="margin:0px"><br>
<hr width="100" align="left" style="margin:0.6em; border-top-width:0px; border-right-width:0px; border-left-width:0px; border-style:solid; border-color:rgb(206,206,206)">
<div class="footnote" style="margin:0px">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
<sup>[<a target="_blank" id="ftn.d1934e10876" href="http://abloz.com/hbase/book.html#d1934e10876" rel="nofollow" class="para" style="color:rgb(255,153,0); text-decoration:none">30</a>] </sup>Image courtesy of Lars George, <a target="_blank" class="link" href="http://www.larsgeorge.com/2009/10/hbase-architecture-101-storage.html" rel="nofollow" style="color:rgb(255,153,0); text-decoration:none">hbase-architecture-101-storage.html</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.  HBase file format with inline blocks (version 2)" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h2 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -62.40625px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3; clear:both">
<a target="_blank" name="t699" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="apes03" id="apes03" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.  HBase 带内嵌数据块的文件格式 (version 2)</h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.1.  Overview" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t700" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e10910" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.1.  概述</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The version of HBase introducing the above features reads both version 1 and 2 HFiles, but only writes version 2 HFiles. A version 2 HFile is structured as follows:<span class="inlinemediaobject"><img src="http://abloz.com/hbase/images/hfilev2.png" align="middle" alt="HFile Version 2" style="border:none; max-width:100%"></span></p>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.2. Unified version 2 block format" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t701" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e10925" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.2. 统一版本 2 的块格式</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
In the version 2 every block in the data section contains the following fields:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
8 bytes: Block type, a sequence of bytes equivalent to version 1's "magic records". Supported block types are:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
DATA – data blocks</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
LEAF_INDEX – leaf-level index blocks in a multi-level-block-index</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
BLOOM_CHUNK – Bloom filter chunks</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
META – meta blocks (not used for Bloom filters in version 2 anymore)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
INTERMEDIATE_INDEX – intermediate-level index blocks in a multi-level blockindex</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
ROOT_INDEX – root&gt;level index blocks in a multi&gt;level block index</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
FILE_INFO – the “file info” block, a small key&gt;value map of metadata</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
BLOOM_META – a Bloom filter metadata block in the load&gt;on&gt;open section</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
TRAILER – a fixed&gt;size file trailer. As opposed to the above, this is not an HFile v2 block but a fixed&gt;size (for each HFile version) data structure</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
INDEX_V1 – this block type is only used for legacy HFile v1 block</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Compressed size of the block's data, not including the header (int).</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Can be used for skipping the current data block when scanning HFile data.</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Uncompressed size of the block's data, not including the header (int)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
This is equal to the compressed size if the compression algorithm is NON</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
File offset of the previous block of the same type (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Can be used for seeking to the previous data/index block</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Compressed data (or uncompressed data if the compression algorithm is NONE).</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The above format of blocks is used in the following HFile sections:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Scanned block section. The section is named so because it contains all data blocks that need to be read when an HFile is scanned sequentially.  Also contains leaf block index and Bloom chunk blocks.</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Non-scanned block section. This section still contains unified-format v2 blocks but it does not have to be read when doing a sequential scan. This section contains “meta” blocks and intermediate-level index blocks.</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
We are supporting “meta” blocks in version 2 the same way they were supported in version 1, even though we do not store Bloom filter data in these blocks anymore.</p>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.3.  Block index in version 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t702" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e10994" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.3.  Block index in version 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
There are three types of block indexes in HFile version 2, stored in two different formats (root and non-root):</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Data index — version 2 multi-level block index, consisting of:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Version 2 root index, stored in the data block index section of the file</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Optionally, version 2 intermediate levels, stored in the non%root format in the data index section of the file. Intermediate levels can only be present if leaf level blocks are present</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Optionally, version 2 leaf levels, stored in the non%root format inline with data blocks</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Meta index — version 2 root index format only, stored in the meta index section of the file</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Bloom index — version 2 root index format only, stored in the “load-on-open” section as part of Bloom filter metadata.</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.4.  Root block index format in version 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t703" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e11019" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.4.  Root block index format in version 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
This format applies to:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Root level of the version 2 data index</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Entire meta and Bloom indexes in version 2, which are always single-level.</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
A version 2 root index block is a sequence of entries of the following format, similar to entries of a version 1 block index, but storing on-disk size instead of uncompressed size.</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Offset (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
This offset may point to a data block or to a deeper&gt;level index block.</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
On-disk size (int)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key (a serialized byte array stored using Bytes.writeByteArray)</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key (VInt)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key bytes</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
A single-level version 2 block index consists of just a single root index block. To read a root index block of version 2, one needs to know the number of entries. For the data index and the meta index the number of entries is stored in the trailer, and for
 the Bloom index it is stored in the compound Bloom filter metadata.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
For a multi-level block index we also store the following fields in the root index block in the load-on-open section of the HFile, in addition to the data structure described above:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Middle leaf index block offset</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Middle leaf block on-disk size (meaning the leaf index block containing the reference to the “middle” data block of the file)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The index of the mid-key (defined below) in the middle leaf-level block.</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
These additional fields are used to efficiently retrieve the mid-key of the HFile used in HFile splits, which we define as the first key of the block with a zero-based index of (n – 1) / 2, if the total number of blocks in the HFile is n. This definition is
 consistent with how the mid-key was determined in HFile version 1, and is reasonable in general, because blocks are likely to be the same size on average, but we don’t have any estimates on individual key/value pair sizes.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
When writing a version 2 HFile, the total number of data blocks pointed to by every leaf-level index block is kept track of. When we finish writing and the total number of leaf-level blocks is determined, it is clear which leaf-level block contains the mid-key,
 and the fields listed above are computed.  When reading the HFile and the mid-key is requested, we retrieve the middle leaf index block (potentially from the block cache) and get the mid-key value from the appropriate position inside that leaf block.</p>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.5.  Non-root block index format in version 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t704" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e11072" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.5.  Non-root block index format in version 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
This format applies to intermediate-level and leaf index blocks of a version 2 multi-level data block index. Every non-root index block is structured as follows.</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
numEntries: the number of entries (int).</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
entryOffsets: the “secondary index” of offsets of entries in the block, to facilitate a quick binary search on the key (numEntries + 1 int values). The last value is the total length of all entries in this index block. For example, in a non-root index block
 with entry sizes 60, 80, 50 the “secondary index” will contain the following int array: {0, 60, 140, 190}.</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Entries. Each entry contains:</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Offset of the block referenced by this entry in the file (long)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
On&gt;disk size of the referenced block (int)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Key. The length can be calculated from entryOffsets.</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li></ol>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.6.  Bloom filters in version 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t705" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e11097" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.6.  Bloom filters in version 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
In contrast with version 1, in a version 2 HFile Bloom filter metadata is stored in the load-on-open section of the HFile for quick startup.</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="1" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 78.015625px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
A compound Bloom filter.</p>
<div class="orderedlist" style="margin:0px">
<ol class="orderedlist" type="a" style="margin:0px 0px 0px 72.109375px; line-height:1.2">
<li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Bloom filter version = 3 (int). There used to be a DynamicByteBloomFilter class that had the Bloom filter version number 2</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The total byte size of all compound Bloom filter chunks (long)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Number of hash functions (int</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Type of hash functions (int)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The total key count inserted into the Bloom filter (long)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The maximum total number of keys in the Bloom filter (long)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The number of chunks (int)</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Comparator class used for Bloom filter keys, a UTF&gt;8 encoded string stored using Bytes.writeByteArray</p>
</li><li class="listitem">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Bloom block index in the version 2 root block index format</p>
</li></ol>
</div>
</li></ol>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.7. File Info format in versions 1 and 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t706" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e11134" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.7. File Info format in versions 1 and 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The file info block is a serialized <a target="_blank" class="ulink" href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/io/HBaseMapWritable.html" rel="nofollow" style="color:rgb(255,153,0); text-decoration:none">HBaseMapWritable</a> (essentially
 a map from byte arrays to byte arrays) with the following keys, among others. StoreFile-level logic adds more keys to this.</p>
<div class="informaltable" style="margin:0px">
<table border="1">
<colgroup><col><col></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
hfile.LASTKEY</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The last key of the file (byte array)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
hfile.AVG_KEY_LEN</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The average key length in the file (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
hfile.AVG_VALUE_LEN</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The average value length in the file (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
File info format did not change in version 2. However, we moved the file info to the final section of the file, which can be loaded as one block at the time the HFile is being opened. Also, we do not store comparator in the version 2 file info anymore. Instead,
 we store it in the fixed file trailer. This is because we need to know the comparator at the time of parsing the load-on-open section of the HFile.</p>
</div>
<div class="section" title="E.3.8.  Fixed file trailer format differences between versions 1 and 2" style="margin:0px">
<div class="titlepage" style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<div style="margin:0px">
<h3 class="title" style="margin:0.8em 0px 0px -46.8125px; padding:0px; color:rgb(153,0,0); line-height:1.3">
<a target="_blank" name="t707" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a><a target="_blank" name="d1934e11180" style="color:rgb(255,153,0)"></a>E.3.8.  Fixed file trailer format differences between versions 1 and 2</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The following table shows common and different fields between fixed file trailers in versions 1 and 2. Note that the size of the trailer is different depending on the version, so it is “fixed” only within one version. However, the version is always stored as
 the last four-byte integer in the file.</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
<div class="informaltable" style="margin:0px">
<table border="1">
<colgroup><col class="c1"><col class="c2"></colgroup>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Version 1</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Version 2</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" align="center" style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
File info offset (long)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Data index offset (long)</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
loadOnOpenOffset (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
<span class="emphasis"><em>The offset of the section that we need toload when opening the file.</em></span></p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" align="center" style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Number of data index entries (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
metaIndexOffset (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
This field is not being used by the version 1 reader, so we removed it from version 2.</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
uncompressedDataIndexSize (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The total uncompressed size of the whole data block index, including root-level, intermediate-level, and leaf-level blocks.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" align="center" style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Number of meta index entries (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" align="center" style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Total uncompressed bytes (long)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
numEntries (int)</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
numEntries (long)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" align="center" style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Compression codec: 0 = LZO, 1 = GZ, 2 = NONE (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The number of levels in the data block index (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
firstDataBlockOffset (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The offset of the first first data block. Used when scanning.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
lastDataBlockEnd (long)</p>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
The offset of the first byte after the last key/value data block. We don't need to go beyond this offset when scanning.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Version: 1 (int)</p>
</td>
<td style="line-height:1.2">
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
Version: 2 (int)</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
<p style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:0px; padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:0px">
</p>
</div>
</div>
